page.title: 01NORTH EAST WILTSHIRE BORDER
page.content: Area of O.N.B. Principally mixed farmland. Woodland consists of small mixed plantations. The ancient fortification 'The Wansdyke' ends on the Berks/Wilts Border.Ham, pop 145, houses mainly owner occupied, some tied cottages. The centre of the village is the green, surrounded by some old thatched cottages and the Crown and Anchor public house. The Victorian school house (formally C. of E.) is now a private residence. The church (All Saints) is 14thC. The Manor House is early 17thC, with 18th and 19thC additions, there is an Elizabethan Mound in the garden. Eastcourt is 17thC and was the court house. The Rectory is mainly Victorian, no longer Church property. Ham Spray House, 18thC and situated 1/2 mile on Inkpen road, is noted for occupied by Lytton Strachey.
